Stem: Wiry. Short, green shoots form pseudo-leaves (cladodes) replacing true leaves.
Leaves: Reduced, scale-like, replaced by narrow shoots 3-20 mm long, greyish-green, in groups of three.
Flowers: Solitary or in pairs, greenish to white, with six petal-like tepals, stalked 5-11 mm.
FruitSeeds: Whitish or blue-grey, spherical to egg-shaped berries with 2-14 seeds.
Habitat: Bushland, woodlands, streams, roadsides, coastal habitats.
DistinguishingFeatures: Pseudo-leaves in threes, and distinctive whitish to blue-grey berry.
